adr_address: Piazza della Repubblica, 17, 20124 Milano MI, Italy

editorial_summary.overview: Ritzy hotel with 2 chic restaurants, plus a spa, an indoor pool & free limo service.

formatted_address: Piazza della Repubblica, 17, 20124 Milano MI, Italy
name: Principe di Savoia

plus_code.compound_code: F5HW+WM Milan, Metropolitan City of Milan, Italy

reviews.text:
Second time staying here. We like the classic interior and overall vibe. Staff is very nice and attentive. Breakfast buffet is excellent — honestly the main reason we keep coming back. Rooms are spacious and comfortable.

The only downside is the so-called “voluntary” 5% surcharge for staff that’s already added to the bill. Voluntary would be asking if you’d like to add something, not putting it on automatically. At ~€800-1000 a night, 5% is substantial. We didn’t have it removed because doing so in front of staff and other guests would have felt embarrassing. This is unusual, especially since we’d been tipping staff throughout our stay. The hotel should have more empathy than to put guests in that position at checkout.

Honestly, this has been one of the best hotel experiences we’ve ever had - and we’ve stayed at places all over the world! The service was truly exceptional. Every staff member was kind, attentive, and went out of their way to help, even with the smallest things. They offered us water for our day trip to the lake when we were leaving, and even delivered items we forgot in the car straight to our room at 2 AM! That kind of care is so rare. And as a sweet surprise, they even sent us a cake while we were having lunch at another hotel. Just incredible. We’re genuinely so impressed and would come back

Best hotel I've ever stayed at and I've been to a lot! From check-in to check-out everything was perfect. The room was gorgeous, the staff were super helpful and friendly.  The gym and pool were blissful, the food glorious. Not inexpensive, but truly worth every cent.

What can I say about this fabulous hotel?  Great location, close to the train station.  Outstanding service from the get go.  We only recall Mateo's name at check-in, but everyone we interacted with, from the porter to the doormen, to the staff at the pool/spa area, the breakfast area and the restaurant was outstanding.  It was a short one night stay capping off a birthday celebration, but Principe di Savoia made it memorable.  Thank you!

We arrived at this hotel with our rental car as a family and stayed for 5 nights and 4 days. Each day, we also used the valet service, which is managed by the concierge department, as you know. When handing over the car, the hotel provides a report to the room, checking if there are any scratches, damages, or dents on the vehicle, and records it. All reports showed no issues.

However, when I received the car back on Wednesday, August 27th, the right front and right rear sides of the car were very clearly scratched. I immediately informed the concierge manager about this situation.

At first, he claimed it was not their responsibility and that the car had already been in that condition. But once I showed him the official car report sent to my room, it became clear that the damage had happened while in their care.

The concierge manager took my phone number and assured me that he would investigate the matter and get back to me. But, as you might guess, nobody ever followed up with me. I am a businessman, so I don’t chase after such matters which is why I didn’t go back again to remind them that they never returned to me.

Because in a well-managed hotel, the concierge department would certainly update the guest regarding such an important matter.
Instead, nobody said anything, and I assume they expected me to forget about it.

This is not about the money—it is insignificant to me. i paid 7.000 euro this hotel for 4 days.
The real issue is that a hotel of this standard could treat its guest in such a manner, showing no regard and failing to provide any feedback.

I found this very disappointing and unworthy of such an establishment
